lead_paragraph: A federal jury awarded $260,000 yesterday to one of two men who sued the N.B.A. star Allen Iverson after they said they were beaten by his entourage at a Washington nightclub in 2005.The jury’s decision against Iverson and his bodyguard, Jason Kane, covers the medical bills and the pain and suffering of the man, Marlin Godfrey. But the jury chose not to award punitive damages, which could have raised the award.Godfrey and another patron, David Anthony Kittrell, sued Iverson, a guard for the Denver Nuggets, for $20 million, saying they were beaten by his entourage in July 2005. The attacks, they said, followed their refusal to vacate the Eyebar club’s V.I.P. section for Iverson.Iverson testified last week that he did not see the fight and left the club before the brawl became serious. Iverson was found negligent for failing to supervise Kane. The jury did not find either man liable for assaulting Kittrell.
